text: “Adjusted Base Price” means, as of any date other than the Closing Date, the price expressed as a percentage: (i) in the case of a Note with an Initial Base Price in excess of 100%, by amortizing the Note Premium on a constant yield-to-maturity basis (compounding at the end of each interest period) over the remaining term, or, if the Note is prepayable, to an earlier date and price that minimizes the Holder’s yield on the Note, all in accordance with the provisions of
section_heading: Section 1.01 which are defined in the Servicing Agreement or in a Loan Document shall have the

text: “Adjusted Capital Account Deficit” means, with respect to any Class A/B Arrangement Beneficial Owner, the deficit balance, if any, in such Beneficial Owner’s Capital Account as of the end of the relevant Fiscal Year, after giving effect to the following adjustments: 3 4135-7643-8109 (a) credit to such Capital Account any amounts that such Class A/B Arrangement Beneficial Owner is obligated to restore or is deemed to be obligated to restore pursuant to the penultimate sentences of Sections 1.704-2(g)(1) and 1.704-2(i)(5) of the Regulations; and (b) debit from such Capital Account the items described in Sections 1.704-1(b)(2)(ii)(d)(4), (5) and (6) of the Regulations.

text: “Affiliates” means, with respect to any specified Person, (a) any Person directly or indirectly Controlling, Controlled by or under common Control with the specified Person and shall include any director, officer or trustee of the specified Person; and (b) any Person directly, indirectly or beneficially owning or Controlling more than 50% of any class of voting securities of the specified Person.

text: “Disposition” means, with respect to a Note, any sale, repayment, payment at maturity, redemption or other disposition of such Note, including any such action that results in the realization of gain or loss under applicable Code provisions.
section_heading: Section 171 of the Code; (ii) in the case of a Note issued with original issue discount, by accruing

text: “Disposition Gain” means (i) with respect to the Disposition of a Note, the excess (if any) of the amount realized from such Disposition over the product of the unpaid balance of the Note and its Adjusted Base Price, (ii) with respect to a partial payment of Note Principal, the product of (A) the amount of such Note Principal payment and (B) the sum of 100% less its Adjusted Base Price, provided, if (B) is a negative number, the Disposition Gain shall be zero, or (iii) with respect to a payment of Note Principal, in whole or in part, the amount of Note Premium, if any, paid by the Borrower.
section_heading: Section 171 of the Code; (ii) in the case of a Note issued with original issue discount, by accruing

text: “Disposition Loss” means, with respect to the Disposition of a Note, the excess (if any) of (i) the product of the unpaid balance of the Note and its Adjusted Base Price over (ii) the amount realized from such Disposition as determined under the Code.

text: “Permitted Investments” means any one or more of the following dollar-denominated investments which are exempt from both U.S. federal income taxation and state income taxation: (i) commercial paper having a rating of no less than “A-1+”/“P-1”, and (ii) money market funds having a rating of no less than “A-1+”.
section_heading:

text: “Person” means any individual, partnership, joint venture, corporation, trust, limited liability company, or unincorporated association, any other entity and any government or any department or agency thereof, whether acting in an individual, fiduciary or other capacity.

text: “Portfolio” means the discrete pool of assets, consisting of the Loans which the Seller or its affiliates have made to municipalities and agencies and the Notes evidencing the same and identified on Schedule I.

text: “Portfolio Assets” means, collectively, (i) the rights, title and interests of the Issuer under the Loan Documents, including the Notes; (ii) the rights, title and interests of the Issuer, if any, in any Project; (iii) the Issuer’s rights under the Portfolio Purchase Agreement; (iv) the Priority Transfer Right; and (v) all funds and accounts created in this Trust Agreement. 13 4135-7643-8109 “Portfolio Purchase Agreement” means the Portfolio Purchase Agreement, between the Issuer, as purchaser, and the Seller dated the Closing Date.
section_heading:

text: “Principal Shortfall Amount” means, upon a Final Recovery Determination, the difference between the unpaid principal balance of a defaulted Loan and the actual Note Principal received by the Trustee with respect to such defaulted Loan.
section_heading:

text: “Priority Transfer Right” means the right of the Trustee (assigned to it by the Issuer for the benefit of the Class A Certificateholders) to receive from the Escrow Custodian amounts transferred from the Escrow Account for deposit to the Distribution Account.
section_heading:

text: “Profits” and “Losses” means, for each Fiscal Year or other period, an amount equal to the applicable Class A/B Arrangement’s taxable income or loss for such Fiscal Year or period determined by the Servicing Advisor in accordance with Section 703(a) of the Code, which, for this purpose, shall include all items of income, gain, loss or deduction required to be stated separately pursuant to Section 703(a)(1) of the Code, with the following adjustments: (a) any income from the Portfolio Assets that is exempt from federal income tax and not otherwise taken into account in computing Profits or Losses pursuant to this definition shall be added to such taxable income or loss; (b) any expenditures of the Class A/B Arrangement described in Section 705(a)(2)(B) of the Code or treated as such Section 705(a)(2)(B) expenditures pursuant to Section 1.704-1(b)(2)(iv)(i) of the Regulations and not otherwise taken into account in computing Profits or Losses pursuant to this definition shall be subtracted from such taxable income or loss; (c) Disposition Gains and Disposition Losses shall be excluded in computing Profits or Losses; and (d) any items of income and expense that are specially allocated pursuant to
section_heading:
Section 4.01(a).
“Note Rate” means the interest rate payable on a Note identified as such on Schedule I.

text: “Project” means the real estate or housing investment financed by the issuance of a Note.
section_heading: Section 8.02 shall be excluded from the calculation of Profits and Losses.

text: “Responsible Officer” means, (a) when used with respect to the Trustee or Escrow Custodian performing in its respective capacity as trustee or escrow custodian, any officer within the corporate trust department of the Trustee or the Escrow Custodian, including any managing director, vice president, assistant vice president, assistant secretary, assistant treasurer, trust officer or any other officer of the Trustee or the Escrow Custodian who customarily performs functions similar to those performed by Persons who at the time shall be such officers, respectively, or to whom any corporate trust matter is referred because of such person’s knowledge of and familiarity with the particular subject and in each case who shall have direct responsibility for the administration of this Trust Agreement; and (b) when used with respect to the Document Custodian performing in its capacity as document custodian, any officer within the document custody department of the Document Custodian, including any managing director, vice president, assistant vice president, assistant secretary, assistant treasurer, trust officer or any other officer of the Document Custodian who customarily performs functions similar to those performed by Persons who at the time shall be such officers, respectively, or to whom any document custody matter is referred because of such person’s knowledge of and familiarity with the particular subject and in each case who shall have direct responsibility for the administration of this Trust Agreement.

Section 3.02.
“Regulations” or “Treasury Regulations” means the Treasury Regulations promulgated

Section 3.02.
“Regulations” or “Treasury Regulations” means the Treasury Regulations promulgated

section_heading:
Section 3.02.
“Regulations” or “Treasury Regulations” means the Treasury Regulations promulgated

text: Any agreement, instrument or statute defined or referred to herein or in any instrument or certificate delivered in connection herewith means such agreement, instrument or statute as from time to time amended, modified or supplemented and includes (in the case of agreements or instruments) references to all attachments thereto and instruments incorporated therein; references to a Person are also to its permitted successors and assigns.
section_heading: Section 1.02. Rules of Construction.

text: On or prior to the Closing Date, the Trustee shall establish a segregated account, the “Distribution Account,” and three segregated sub-accounts therein, the “Note Interest Sub-Account,” the “Note Premium Sub-Account” and the “Note Principal Sub- Account,” for the benefit of the Holders and Beneficial Owners. 27 4135-7643-8109 (b) The Trustee shall deposit all Note Payments, P&I Advances, amounts transferred by the Escrow Custodian from the Escrow Account, together with all proceeds from the sale or disposition of the Notes or any other moneys it receives, in all cases to the extent such moneys are designated or attributable to interest pursuant to the terms of a Note, in the Note Interest Sub-Account of the Distribution Account.
section_heading: Section 4.01. Accounts.

text: The Trustee shall deposit all Note Payments, together with all proceeds from the sale or disposition of the Notes or any other moneys it receives, in all cases to the extent such moneys are designated or attributable to premium payable by a Borrower pursuant to the terms of the related Note, in the Note Premium Sub-Account of the Distribution Account.
section_heading: Section 4.01. Accounts.

text: The Trustee shall deposit all Note Payments, P&I Advances, amounts transferred by the Escrow Custodian from the Escrow Account, together with all proceeds from the sale or disposition of the Notes or any other moneys it receives, in all cases to the extent such moneys are designated or attributable to principal pursuant to the terms of a Note, in the Note Principal Sub-Account of the Distribution Account.
section_heading: Section 4.01. Accounts.

text: All amounts in the Distribution Account and the earnings on the investment of such amounts shall be invested by the Trustee, at the written direction of the Issuer, only in Permitted Investments, so that such Permitted Investments may be liquidated to make the payments to be made on each Distribution Date.
section_heading: Section 4.01. Accounts.

text: Absent such written direction, such amounts shall be held uninvested.
section_heading: Section 4.01. Accounts.

text: Earnings on amounts on deposit in the Distribution Account shall be treated and distributed as if such earnings were Note Interest.
section_heading: Section 4.01. Accounts.

text: Upon receipt of Note Payments from the Master Servicer, the Trustee shall: (i) determine if the amount representing Note Interest on deposit in the Distribution Account, together with the amount set forth in any related Advances Report, is sufficient to pay the Administrative Fees as set forth in Section 4.02 and to make all Distributions to the Class A Holders as set forth in Section 4.03(a)(i) and, if the amount so determined is insufficient for such purposes, direct the Escrow Custodian in writing to transfer to the Trustee from and to the extent of funds on deposit in the Escrow Account the amounts sufficient to make the payments set forth in Section 4.03(a)(i) and deposit such amounts in the Note Interest Sub- Account of the Distribution Account; and (ii) determine if a Principal Shortfall Amount will still exist after reducing the Certificate Balance of the Class B Certificate to zero pursuant to Section 4.03(b)(ii)(A) and, if so, direct the Escrow Custodian in writing to transfer to the Trustee from and to the extent of funds on deposit in the Escrow Account the amounts sufficient to make the payments set forth in Section 4.03(b)(ii)(B)(2) and 4.03(b)(ii)(B)(3) and deposit such amounts the Note Principal Sub-Account of the Distribution Account. 28 4135-7643-8109
section_heading: Section 4.01. Accounts.

text: On each Distribution Date, the Trustee shall pay, from the amounts on deposit in the Note Interest Sub-Account of the Distribution Account, the Administrative Fees, in arrears, in the following order of priority, each priority being fully paid before proceeds are used to pay any lower priority and no payment being made on any priority if the proceeds have been exhausted in the payment of higher priorities: (i) to the Trustee, the Trustee Fee; (ii) to the Escrow Custodian, the Escrow Custodian Fee; (iii) to the Issuer, the Issuer Fee; (iv) to the Dissemination Agent, the Dissemination Agent Fee; and (v) to CREFC®, the CREFC® Royalty Fee.
section_heading: Section 4.02. Administrative Fees.

text: Each of the above fees will be paid monthly and will be calculated on a Loan by Loan basis as the product of (i) the unpaid principal balance of each Note as of the first day of the immediately preceding calendar month, (ii) the applicable rate per annum, and (iii) the accrual basis for the respective Note.
section_heading: Section 4.02. Administrative Fees.

text: On each Distribution Date, after paying the Administrative Fees set forth in Section 4.02, the Trustee shall apply amounts on deposit in the Note Interest Sub-Account of the Distribution Account and any earnings thereon, in the order of priority listed, as follows: (i) to the Class A Certificateholders, on a pari passu basis between Classes of the Class A Certificates, Distributions on the Certificate Balance of the Class A Certificates at the applicable Class A Rate, determined by reference to the Class Factor calculated by the Trustee as set forth in subsection (f) below; provided, however, that if, as a result of any default or delinquency on one or more of the Loans, the Available Note Interest is insufficient to make such Distributions on the Class A Certificates, then the Trustee shall, to the extent of the funds available: (A) make Distributions in respect of Note Interest on the Certificate Balance of the Class A-1 Certificates at the Class A-1 Rate determined by reference to the Class Factor calculated by the Trustee as set forth in subsection (f) below, first, from Available Note Interest and, if such Available Note Interest is insufficient, then from amounts withdrawn from the Common Sub-Account as set forth in Section 4.01(f)(i); and then (B) make Distributions in respect of Note Interest on the Certificate Balance of the Class A-2 Certificates at the Class A-2 Rate determined by reference to the Class Factor calculated by the Trustee as set 29 4135-7643-8109 forth in subsection (f) below, first, from Available Note Interest and, if such Available Note Interest is insufficient, then from amounts withdrawn from the Class A-2 Sub-Account as set forth in Section 4.01(f)(i) and then from amounts withdrawn from the Common Sub-Account as set forth in Section 4.01(f)(i).
section_heading: Section 4.03. Distributions.

text: On each Distribution Date, the Trustee shall apply Available Note Principal to make payments of the Certificate Balance of the Class A Certificates, on a pro rata basis between Classes of the Class A Certificates, until the Certificate Balance of the Class A Certificates is reduced to zero, and, after the Certificate Balance of the Class A Certificates is reduced to zero, to make payments of the Certificate Balance of the Class B Certificates.
section_heading: Section 4.03. Distributions.

text: If a Principal Shortfall Amount exists, then the Trustee shall: (A) reduce the Certificate Balance of the Class B Certificates, without any payment therefore, by an amount equal to the Principal Shortfall Amount until the Certificate Balance of the Class B Certificates is reduced to zero and then reduce the Principal Shortfall Amount by an amount equal to such reduction in the Certificate Balance of the Class B Certificates; (B) if, after taking the actions in clause (A) above, a Principal Shortfall Amount still exists, then the Trustee shall: (1) calculate the sum of the amount on deposit in the Note Principal Sub-Account of the Distribution Account (“Available Note Principal”) and the Principal Shortfall Amount and then allocate such sum to the Class A-1 Certificates and the Class A-2 Certificates, on a pro rata basis according to the respective Certificate Balances (the amount so allocated to the Class A-1 30 4135-7643-8109 Certificates, the “Class A-1 Principal Due” and the amount so allocated to the Class A-2 Certificates, the “Class A-2 Principal Due”); then (2) pay to the Class A-1 Certificateholders the Class A- 1 Principal Due, first from Available Note Principal and, if such Available Note Principal is insufficient, then from amounts withdrawn from the Common Sub-Account as set forth in Section 4.01(f)(ii) (and reduce the Principal Amount Shortfall by the amounts withdrawn from the Escrow Account); and then (3) pay to the Class A-2 Certificateholders the Class A- 2 Principal Due, first from Available Note Principal remaining after taking the actions in clause (2) above and, if such Available Note Principal is insufficient, then from amounts withdrawn from the Class A-2 Sub-Account as set forth in Section 4.01(f)(ii) and then from amounts withdrawn from the Common Sub-Account as set forth in Section 4.01(f)(ii) (and reduce the Principal Amount Shortfall by the amounts withdrawn from the Escrow Account); and then (4) to the extent a Principal Shortfall Amount still exists, reduce the Certificate Balance of the Class A-2 Certificates by an amount equal to the remaining Principal Shortfall Amount (and reduce the Principal Shortfall Amount by the amount of the reduction of Certificate Balance of the Class A-2 Certificates) until the Certificate Balance of the Class A-2 Certificates is reduced to zero; and then (5) to the extent a Principal Shortfall Amount still exists, reduce the Certificate Balance of the Class A-1 Certificates by an amount equal to the remaining Principal Shortfall Amount until the Certificate Balance of the Class A-2 Certificates is reduced to zero.
section_heading: Section 4.03. Distributions.

text: Notwithstanding any other provision of Section 4.03(b)(ii), in no event shall the Trustee distribute any amounts on deposit in the Note Principal Sub- Account of the Distribution Account representing amounts transferred from the Class A-2 Sub-Account of the Escrow Account to the Class A-2 Certificateholder if doing so would reduce the Certificate Balance of the Class A-2 Certificates to zero and the Certificate Balance of the Class A-1 Certificates has not already or concurrently been reduced to zero.
section_heading: Section 4.03. Distributions.

text: The Trustee shall, from amounts on deposit in the applicable sub-account of the Distribution Account, (i) apply any portion of an Unscheduled Note Payment constituting Note Interest to make a Distribution of Note Interest in accordance with Section 4.03(a) on the next Distribution Date, (ii) apply any portion of an Unscheduled Note Payment constituting Note Principal 31 4135-7643-8109 (A) to make payments of the Certificate Balance of the Class A Certificates, on a pro rata basis between Classes of the Class A Certificates, until the Certificate Balance of the Class A Certificates is reduced to zero, and (B) after the Certificate Balance of the Class A Certificates is reduced to zero, to make payments of the Certificate Balance of the Class B Certificates, and (iii) apply any portion of a Unscheduled Note Payment constituting Note Premium to make payments to the Class A Certificateholders and the Class B Certificateholders in accordance with Section 4.03(d).
section_heading: Section 4.03. Distributions.

text: On each Distribution Date, for each Loan in respect of which Note Premium was received by the Trustee and deposited to the Note Premium Sub-Account of the Distribution Account by such Distribution Date, provided the Trustee has received an Officer’s Certificate of the Master Servicer or the Special Servicer with respect thereto, which shall include the total amount of Note Premium received and the discount rate set forth in the related Note, the Trustee shall pay such Note Premium to the Certificateholders as follows: (i) to the Class A Certificateholders, on a pro rata basis between Classes of the Class A Certificates, a portion of the Note Premium equal to (A) the amount of the Note Premium received by the Determination Date, multiplied by (B) the quotient of (1) the amount of Note Principal distributed to Class A Certificateholders, over (2) the total amount of Note Principal distributed to Class A Certificateholders and the Class B Certificateholders; and (ii) to the Class B Certificateholders, a portion of the Note Premium equal to (A) the amount of the Note Premium received by the Determination Date, multiplied by (B) the quotient of (1) the amount of Note Principal distributed to Class B Certificateholders, over (2) the total amount of Note Principal distributed to Class A Certificateholders and the Class B Certificateholders.
section_heading: Section 4.03. Distributions.

text: The Trustee shall, from amounts on deposit in the applicable sub-account of the Distribution Account, (i) apply any portion of a Note Payment constituting Note Interest and received after the applicable Determination Date to make a Distribution of Note Interest in accordance with Section 4.03(a) on the next Distribution Date, and (ii) apply any portion of a Note Payment constituting Note Principal and received after the applicable Determination Date (A) to make payments of the Certificate Balance of the Class A Certificates, on a pro rata basis between Classes of the Class A Certificates, until the Certificate Balance of the Class A Certificates is reduced to zero, and (B) after the Certificate Balance of the Class A Certificates is reduced to zero, to make payments of the Certificate Balance of the Class B Certificates, and (iii) apply any portion of a Note Payment constituting Note Premium and received after the applicable Determination Date to make payments to the Class A Certificateholders and the Class B Certificateholders in accordance with Section 4.03(d).
section_heading: Section 4.03. Distributions.

text: On each Distribution Date, the Trustee shall make Distributions on the Certificates based upon the Class Factor determined on the prior Distribution Date or, with respect to the first Distribution Date following the Closing Date, the initial Class Factor.
section_heading: Section 4.03. Distributions.

text: After distributing all Available Note Principal and amounts 32 4135-7643-8109 withdrawn from the Escrow Account, the Trustee will calculate the Class Factors which will be in effect from the next following Business Day to and including the following Distribution Date.
section_heading: Section 4.03. Distributions.

text: The Class Factors so calculated will be made available to Bloomberg via the Trustee’s Reporting Website on the Business Day following such Distribution Date.
section_heading: Section 4.03. Distributions.

text: Distributions of Note Interest on the Certificates will be calculated on a 30/360 basis (i.e., assuming that a year consists of 12 months of 30 days each).
section_heading: Section 4.03. Distributions.

text: Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, the Trustee shall not make any Distributions to a Certificateholder if, by doing so, it would reduce the Certificateholder’s Capital Account below zero, except for any final Distributions of the Portfolio Assets pursuant to Section 9.03 in connection with a Termination Event.
section_heading: Section 4.03(b) shall be in $0.01 increments.

text: A Holder is not required to present its Certificate to the Trustee to receive any Distribution, other than in connection with the final payment of such Certificate.
section_heading: Section 4.03(b) shall be in $0.01 increments.

text: Any Class A Certificate or Class B Certificate receiving payment in full of its Certificate Balance and its Distribution in respect of Note Interest pursuant to this Section shall be cancelled upon receipt of such payment and shall no longer be outstanding.
section_heading: Section 4.03(b) shall be in $0.01 increments.

text: The Trustee shall, to the extent amounts are needed and available from the Escrow Account and the Escrow Custodian has not transferred such amounts in accordance with the Escrow Account Agreement, direct the Escrow Custodian to make such transfer in the amount and by the time required to make the Distributions hereunder.
section_heading: Section 4.03(b) shall be in $0.01 increments.

text: The Trustee shall notify the Servicer of all amounts withdrawn from the Escrow Account.
section_heading: Section 4.03(b) shall be in $0.01 increments.

text: Holders hereunder shall be made without deduction for any taxes, charges, levies or withholdings, except to the extent, if any, that such amounts are required to be withheld under the laws, rules and regulations of the United States of America and any other applicable taxing authority.
section_heading: Section 4.04. Compliance with Withholding Requirements. All cash payments to the

text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Trust Agreement, the Trustee shall comply with all U.S. federal income tax withholding requirements with respect to Distributions.
section_heading: Section 4.04. Compliance with Withholding Requirements. All cash payments to the

text: The consent of the Holder shall not be required for any such withholding, except that no withholding shall be made to the extent that a Holder presents to the Trustee a form evidencing the entitlement to elimination or reduction of such withholding.
section_heading: Section 4.04. Compliance with Withholding Requirements. All cash payments to the

text: In the event the Trustee withholds any amount from a Beneficial Owner pursuant to withholding requirements, the amount so withheld shall be treated as having been distributed to such Beneficial Owner for all purposes of this Trust Agreement and the Trustee shall provide such Beneficial Owner with IRS-required withholding reports when due.
section_heading: Section 4.04. Compliance with Withholding Requirements. All cash payments to the
